thread.title: Ground News - Ex-CHP officer who hit and killed Long Beach pedestrian had unknown vision impairment
thread.title_full: Ground News - Ex-CHP officer who hit and killed Long Beach pedestrian had unknown vision impairment

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Ex-CHP officer who hit and killed Long Beach pedestrian had unknown vision impairment
text:
Summary by Ground News Former Officer Alfredo Gutierrez's medical condition was not known by prosecutors or jurors during his misdemeanor trial in May for the 2019 death of 24-year-old Cezannie Mount. Gutierrez was treated at UC Irvine Medical Center in the early hours of Oct. 22, 2019, for central serous chorioretinopathy, a condition that distorts vision because of a build-up of fluids beneath the retina. Less than a week after Gutierrez's first emergency room visit, his motorcycle fatally struck Mount. Share menu More

Press-Telegram Center High Factuality Private Equity: Alden Global Capital Ex-CHP officer who hit and killed Long Beach pedestrian had unknown vision impairment Five days before an off-duty CHP motorcycle officer hit and killed a pedestrian in Long Beach, he went to a hospital emergency room complaining of distorted vision in one eye, according to newly retrieved medical records. Now-former Officer Alfredo Gutierrez’s medical condition was not known by prosecutors or jurors during his misdemeanor trial in May for the 2019 death of 24-year-old Cezannie Mount. Gutierrez, who hit Mount while riding to work…
